text: not all philanthropists are rich a few
coins at a time is how Chen Xiu Jie
earns a living she works up to 18 hours
a day six days a week but no matter how
much she earns she spends no more than
three dollars a day on herself with the
rest she helps other people I feel very
happy after donating money money is only
useful if you give it to people who need
it
poverty is something miss Chen has
struggled with almost all her life she
quit school to help support her family
after her mother died during a difficult
childbirth her brother died a few years
later also because her family couldn't
afford proper medical care but instead
of getting angry the tragedies inspired
her to help the less fortunate with her
modest earnings and simple way of living
miss Chen has managed to donate more
than three hundred and fifty thousand
dollars to a local school hospital and
children's homes like this one which
look after youngsters whose parents
can't care for them many children have
grown up on the money and vegetables she
donates and the charity has built a
second home in another city her
generosity is frequently met with shock
and I'm spraying there's a Wow you've
given one meaning I said I thought 5,000
with 10,000 there's a big money already
and I said wow what can I do I do I ask
you he said well you know what what do
you want what did you pray and you do it
and just help my kids her charity
donations have made miss Chen famous
around the world she's received multiple
honors and awards including this one
from the Filipino president where she
was awarded $50,000
she probably gave the money away to this
local hospital that inspired an
outpouring of donations and a new
medical wing despite the hard work and
back in me problems miss Chen has no
plans to retire well she went all young
and down to Dorchester he says I hope I
can do this forever everyone can do it
it's not just me if you want to do it
you must do it right away
after all you can't take the money with
you when you leave this world Cindy Hsu
BBC news Thai dong city
you
